intro: Reseda subattenuata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved reseda, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of pale yellow or white flowers that bloom in the summer months. Reseda subattenuata is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates.
